intro: Ellertonia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and restricted distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
